rename.from: Increase modularity of netty-codec is backward incompatible change for 4.1
rename.to: Increased modularity of netty-codec is backward incompatible change for 4.1

body: @idelpivnitskiy to understand correctly, does fixing this implies more than adding missing dependencies ?

Correct, to make it work I have to add `io.netty:netty-codec-compression` dependency for our `servicetalk-encoding-netty` module. However, it makes a hard dependency on netty 4.2 and does not allow me to keep ServiceTalk compatible with both 4.1 and 4.2 at the same time.

Alternatively, we can keep it split into smaller modules, but still add `netty-codec-compression` (and others) as a dependency for `netty-codec`. That way users classpath that depends on `netty-codec` won't change.

Compression codecs are quite usually used by `netty-codec-http` and the current Maven dependency onto `netty-codec-compression` is marked as _optional_ because it is possible to use HTTP codecs without compression.

As compression seems in practice widely used when using HTTP, we could make waive the optionality and thus a dependency on `netty-codec-http` would transitively bring `netty-codec-compression` out of the box.

If that option is not enough, another option would be to rename the `netty-codec` to something like `netty-codec-base` and have `netty-codec` depend on `netty-codec-base` + `netty-codec-compression` + `netty-codec-protobuf` + ... and preserve the finer grained modularity we obtained.

I'm agreed with your rational about reducing dependencies and ppl using HTTP without compression, etc.

My main concern is that it will require a lot (!!!) of efforts to migrate users across many projects from 4.1 to 4.2 if we change classpath components. Migration will take forever and users will hate us bcz these days netty is pretty much everywhere.

> As compression seems in practice widely used when using HTTP, we could make waive the optionality and thus a dependency on netty-codec-http would transitively bring netty-codec-compression out of the box.

This won't work for ServiceTalk because our `servicetalk-encoding-netty` does not depend on HTTP, it only depends on `netty-codec`.

Your idea of "empty" `netty-codec`(like `netty-all`) to depend on `netty-codec-base` + `netty-codec-compression` + `netty-codec-protobuf` + `netty-codec-marshalling` is even better than my original proposal of `netty-codec` to depend on `netty-codec-*`. I double checked and realized that `netty-codec-compression` depends on `netty-codec`. Your idea will avoid circular dependency.

> I'm agreed with your rational about reducing dependencies and ppl using HTTP without compression, etc.
> 
> My main concern is that it will require a lot (!!!) of efforts to migrate users across many projects from 4.1 to 4.2 if we change classpath components. Migration will take forever and users will hate us bcz these days netty is pretty much everywhere.
> 
> > As compression seems in practice widely used when using HTTP, we could make waive the optionality and thus a dependency on netty-codec-http would transitively bring netty-codec-compression out of the box.
> 
> This won't work for ServiceTalk because our `servicetalk-encoding-netty` does not depend on HTTP, it only depends on `netty-codec`.
> 
> Your idea of "empty" `netty-codec`(like `netty-all`) to depend on `netty-codec-base` + `netty-codec-compression` + `netty-codec-protobuf` + `netty-codec-marshalling` is even better than my original proposal of `netty-codec` to depend on `netty-codec-*`. I double checked and realized that `netty-codec-compression` depends on `netty-codec`. Your idea will avoid circular dependency.

I agree... The last proposal of @vietj sounds like the way to go.
I'll make a PR for this @normanmaurer

issue.title: Make netty-codec 4.2 Maven artifact behave like 4.1 regarding its dependencies

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

The modularization of `netty-codec` lead to stripping `compression`/`protobuf`/`marshalling` from this module resulting in breaking backward compatibility from a build dependency perspective.

Changes:

Several changes are necessary to accomplish this.

Introduce `netty-codec-base` artifact which holds the code of `netty-codec` declaring the `io.netty.codec` module.

`netty-codec-(compression|protobuf|marshalling)` artifacts depends on `netty-codec-base` instead of `netty-codec`.

`netty-codec` artifact now ships an empty jar declaring the `io.netty.codec.unused` module (which should be avoided) and depends on `netty-codec-(base|compression|marshalling|protobuf)` artifact, in addition it redeclares the non optional dependencies of marshalling and protobuf as optional.

Completed the modular guide with an explanation to the developer.

Required revapi changes.

Result:

Fixes #14371

body:
Works as expected now: https://github.com/apple/servicetalk/actions/runs/11276735486/job/31361248993
Thank you @vietj!

issue.title: Upgrading to version 4.2.0 broke netty-codec dependencies in tests

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
After upgrading to version `4.2.0` I got this error when trying to run tests with gradle:
```
> Task :test FAILED
Error occurred during initialization of boot layer
java.lang.module.FindException: Module jboss.marshalling not found, required by io.netty.codec.marshalling
```

I had to do fully exclude `netty-codec-marshalling` and `netty-codec-protobuf` to get it to work again: https://github.com/iTitus/skat-java/commit/5443ecd4b847d1ee85cb6fdf680a57b8019aefce

Might be related to #14239 and #14371

issue.title: Depend on codec-base if possible

repository.name: netty
repository.description: Netty project - an event-driven asynchronous network application framework

issue.body:
Motivation:

We should better depend on codec-base if possible and not codec as we really don't need to pull in everything (like protobuf etc) for most cases.

Modifications:

Depend on codec-base

Result:

Fixes https://github.com/netty/netty/issues/15003
